data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 - Interest Subsidy for Plant & Machinery - New
data.benefits: The scheme provides a reimbursement of up to 60% of annual interest on loans for plant and machinery, with a cap of Rs. 150 lakhs per yearfor a period of 7 years.
data.eligibility: Textile and garmenting units purchasing Plant & Machinery under the TUFS (Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme), ATUFS (Amended Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme), or any amended scheme by the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India.
data.conditions: Loan must be taken from commercial banks/financial institutions for the purchase of eligible plant and machinery.
data.beneficiaries: Textile and garmenting units purchasing Plant & Machinery under the TUFS (Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme), ATUFS (Amended Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme), or any amended scheme by the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India.
data.prerequisites: Loan must be taken from commercial banks/financial institutions for the purchase of eligible plant and machinery.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.context: The Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 aims to boost the textile and garment industry in the state. It was introduced to attract investments, create jobs, and position Uttar Pradesh as a leading hub for textile and apparel manufacturing.
data.objective:
a) Attract investment in the textile and apparel sector to the tune of Rs. 10,000 Crore. 

b) Generate employment opportunity for 5 lakh persons. 

c) Development of five (05) Textile and Apparel Parks through private sector. 

d) 50% increase in earnings of Handloom and Power loom weavers.

e) Modernization of power looms and their operation through solar energy. 

f) Increase production of silk yarn in the state.
data.description: Interest subsidy will be provided to the textile and garmenting units on purchase of Plant & Machinery eligible under the TUFS/ATUFS or amended scheme of the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India. 60% amount of the annual interest paid by the unit on the loan taken from commercial banks / financial institutions for plant and machinery will be reimbursed for a maximum period of 07 years. The maximum limit of this interest subsidy for the textile and garmenting units in the state (except Gautam Budh Nagar district) will be Rs. 150 lakhs per annum per unit. The upper limit of this subsidy for units in Gautam Budh Nagar district will be Rs. 75 Lakhs per annum per unit.
data.how_to_apply: Scheme can be applied through Nivesh Mitra Portal of Uttar Pradesh Government
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.funding_mechanism: The beneficiary will get the benefit after the approval of application by the funding facilitator.
data.highlights: The Department of Handloom and Textiles, Government of Uttar Pradesh shall appoint a team of professionals as Project Management Agency (PMA) for policy implementation and supporting the department in publicizing the policy benefits among national / international investors, brands and other stakeholders and providing prompt support to the investors.
data.additional_info: Preference will be given to those resident/s, in purchase of land from UPSIDA, GIDA, NOIDA, GREATER NOIDA or other authorities, to start new employment.
